Power Export

When you export a map using the 'Power Export...' option what is created is a zip file containing a Web Maps export, a Web Outline export and an XML Export to zip.

You must select exactly ONE top level map node to export. The export will be done to full depth.

When you select this option it will open a file browser window pointing at the Compendium / Exports / folder, similar to the one in figure 1, below.

Figure 1. The File Browser dialog


You then need to specify the file you wish to export to and then press 'Save'. The export process will then begin. You will progress bars appear for each of the exports.

You will not be asked to select an export options.

The following are the default export options for the XML export:

Option

Purpose

Export selected nodes only

Takes the currently selected view. There can be only one.

Export current map depth to full

true
Include Meeting and Media Index Data false
Export to Zip Archive with images and Referenced files true
Include your Stencils and Link Groups in Zip Archive true

The following are the default export options for the Outline export:

Option

Purpose

Selected Views

Takes the currently selected view. There can be only one.

Full depth

true

Export each view in a separate HTML file

true
Include reference files? true

Include navigation bar

true

Include node author

false

Include images

true

Include tags and views as inline text

true

No node detail pages

false

Include all node detail pages

true

Include node detail pages for Dates

not used

Display detail page dates

false

Include anchors on node labels

true

Include anchors on node detail pages

true

Use images for anchors

true (anchor0.gif)

The following are the deafult export options for the Web Maps export:

Option

Setting

Selected Views

Takes the currently selected view. There can be only one.

Full depth

true
List Views Alphabetically on Menu? false
Include reference files? true
